##One-on-one truth and consolation inside and outside the besieged city

Micro Signal, Peopleweekly

Feature description, portrait of the Times.

While everyone was busy with supplies, beds, treatment, disease control and resumption of work, one artist advocated that every outsider find and get to know a Wuhan friend in his own way. "Chat with him every day, give each other care and comfort. " "Get to know a Wuhan Friend" program like stars, a day to gather thousands of participants

This article first appeared in the southern people's weekly
By Yu Deng, staff writer
Intern reporters: Liu Ruirui, Liu Jiawei
Editor | Zhou Jianping rwzkjpz@163. Com
The full text is about 6240, and it takes about 14 minutes to peruse

While everyone was busy with supplies, beds, treatment, disease control and resumption of work, one artist advocated that every outsider find and get to know a Wuhan friend in his own way. "Chat with him every day, give each other care and comfort. " "Get to know a Wuhan Friend" program like stars, a day to gather thousands of participants

This article first appeared in the southern people's weekly

By Yu Deng, staff writer

Intern reporters: Liu Ruirui, Liu Jiawei

Editor | Zhou Jianping rwzkjpz@163. Com

The full text is about 6240, and it takes about 14 minutes to peruse

A nurse, Yang Liu, and a child draw a picture of a pig, Petch, on the 18th floor of the Medical Department building of Wuhan Children's Hospital, Feb. 28,2010

I know a friend in Wuhan

Wechat confirms "adding friends" and says "hello" . Double-check. double-check.

Starting at 4 p.m. on Feb. 3, the movement was repeated at least 1,140 times over a 24 hour period.

At that time, the number of new cases in China reached an all-time high; three provincial Red Cross cadres were prosecuted in Hubei Province; and Li Lanjuan's team said that new drugs had been found to suppress the virus... and on Weibo, the information platform most people rely on, there were endless calls for help, anecdotal news of the epidemic, recriminations and invective.

"My girlfriend often gets anxious, angry and even weeps because of these messages. I wonder what I can do, " said Lin Zi, an artist in Beijing who has a vague sense that some messages may have been exaggerated or distorted. Why not let a person outside the quarantine zone and a Wuhan resident become good friends on Wechat, care about each other, and share their views and feelings? "chats can be re-circulated or at least preserved as evidence of history, making it possible for future displays. "

Lin named the art project "meet a Wuhan Friend" ("friend plan") and created a photo caption that was posted on her friend's circle.

Half an hour later, the number of participants had exploded, bringing the total to more than 1,140 by the afternoon of February 4. To facilitate contact, Lin and his girlfriend have set up nine wechat groups. "outbreak online dating club + Forum" version 1.0 was born.

Lin Zitu / Lin Zi, the initiator of the "know a Wuhan Friend" project

According to Hayashi's idea, the two ends of the friend program should be connected by "people in the quarantine area who are not directly related to the epidemic" and "people outside the quarantine area who are not related to the epidemic" .

After a little excited greeting, the warm-hearted people in the group to throw out the patient help information to fill out the form, some people expressed their willingness to share online psychological free consultation resources; There are also soothsayers to introduce meditation methods, "pray for the disaster area" of Buddhist music and Dharma.

The question of whether the Ridgeway experiment would work was also a matter of concern.

There is always the suspicion that new drug trials are "human trials, inhumane, " and Xiao Wang, a member of the group who works as a clinical supervisor at a pharmaceutical company in Shanghai, is a little embarrassed, in Qunlikepu: "We usually try to enter the group for two years, Ridgway Phase III into the group of nine days into the 75% , their trial program is a control group of four blind. ". The control group was also treated with drugs, and everyone was treated."Xiao Wang's routine work is to do clinical research on chronic diseases such as diabetes, it is a rule of thumb that you need to visit patients in the hospital frequently. "patients need to sign an informed consent form. They will be insured. If there is a problem, stop taking the drug and use insurance to pay for it. "

In the participant Cao Xi's eyes, the plan group at that time was like a miniature of the outside world's impression of Wuhan. They were in a hurry, but at least they were still solving one problem after another.

In addition to sharing information and popular science, some of the group's older rock fans are missing SMZB and Dada (both wuhan-based bands) and Vox (Wuhan Bar) has formed a folk rescue team, "It's a very, very early rescue party. "

"East L. IS BEAUTIFUL! " "I want to go too! " "Let's get together after the epidemic. " 

"Isn't the conversation going off the rails? Shouldn't we be talking about the epidemic? " Someone yanked the thread back.

"these are just random conversations in a group. one-on-one communication requires a decisive step. Like a group of people coming to a dance party, you still need to find your partner, " said Wen Jie, a member of the group.

"The epidemic is not life. "

Keqi, a Cantonese girl, found her "partner" , a Xiaogan girl studying in Wuhan.

Keqi did not call her by her wechat name, calling her "little sister" throughout. And when I got in touch with Xiaogan, she laughed me straight into her mouth.

Submitted by KEKITU / interviewee

In the eyes of Corky, fat and straightforward, quick-tempered, like another oneself. "She was studying in Wuhan, and when she finally returned to Xiaogan, her parents wouldn't let her leave the house, and she was almost suffocated. When talking about the punk capital of Wuhan in the group, she was the most active one, a girl who loved to play. "

Love to play the fat on the night of January 22, brush the mobile phone, see someone on the internet said closed city, immediately up to pack things, 2:30 in the morning, actually called a Didi to the railway station. "they said I don't usually take orders at this time, but I'm going to pick up a friend at the high-speed railway station today, and I'll pick one up along the way. It's lucky, too. "

She laughed and said she wasn't afraid of the virus so she went home overnight. "I was afraid that I would die in Wuhan without money for food. It was even worse for me as a Foodie. I didn't have to worry about it at home. I had snacks. In Wuhan, I had to take care of my family every day to ask for money. I was in dire straits. "

On January 23, Wuhan was shrouded in mist in the early morning. The fat man on the high-speed train looks out of the window and thinks of the dark movie Busan. "I feel very sad, but I believe there will be a sunny day. "

My mother's first thought when she saw her dusty daughter was, "I'm scared to death. " "She's afraid I'll come back with a disease. 'You're all alone, I have your sister at home, ' so I'll stay in my room. "

My father has been working in Shenzhen for years, and he comes home at most once a year. Fatty told me that dad never cared for anyone, let alone asked how he was doing. This year, the insensitive father knew to care for people, the family of four is also the first time to get together for her birthday.

Feifei felt that Keqi's circle of friends looked like her. "She is very optimistic and 'sand sculpture' , unlike other people who are always stuck in a corner with condescending views. It's too [ stupid ] to criticize anything. But Ke Qi is just like your real friend. "

"Have you ever wondered what she looked like, tall, short, fat and thin? "

"that kind of feeling came, and tall short fat thin does not matter, very comfortable. " Fat Simply Reply. "And one day, you go to all the cities and, wow, all my friends, we're all brothers and sisters, and it's Great. "

Keqi was moved by the health and heat of the fat. On the other end of the phone, her voice was a little more sedate than fatty's. Growing up, Keqi devoted herself to voluntary activities in orphanages and nursing homes, and always paid attention to social issues.

"Wow, I'm going to be a mental patient! " corky laughed. "It's not that easy to get into a mental hospital. "

In the neighborhood of Corky's house, she found the multi-layered signs interesting

Photo / corky

Before Graduate Student Graduation, Ke Qi because study pressure is too big, have doubt to oneself ability, internship stage by work organization"squeeze", her mood reached critical point.

A few days ago, Keqi was seeing a psychiatrist in her hometown in Guangdong Province. Often think of Wuhan, Hubei those did not find beds of patients, fragmented families, at risk in the first line of medical staff, workers, she could not restrain.

"The doctor told me that you need to focus on yourself as well as on them. "

After they met Fatty, they didn't talk much about the disease. Fatty says bluntly that he is a glass heart person, really can't bear too much. "everyone knows the situation is serious. If something happens to me (and my family) , it's my turn to be a warrior and I can't run. But when I can hide, I don't want to be forced to face it. "

On the eve of joining the friends program, fatty curled up in bed with a jug of old wine, watching a "bedroom Pogo online cloud music festival. ". During one of the live rounds, she made a friend or two. For two hours, they screamed and "fell" in a band they both loved.

"Right. " The Ke Qi understands the little sister this kind of" revelry" very much. "It doesn't have to be that heavy. ".

They're not exactly rock'n'roll partners, but when it comes to the little monster paintings on the DUB, you can't help it. Keqi directly daubed a few strokes on Wechat and sent her work to Feifei to see. "We also talk about the bad guys that our friends meet online. It's more real, and while the epidemic is real, it's not the whole story. "

Keqi, who has a mild mania for cleanliness, stocked up on disinfectant and wipes during eleven last year

"less than perfect. "

One of the most serious participants she found was Xiao Wu, a Wuhan Native who works as an engineer at a large enterprise in the Guanggu industrial park. Because of the special nature of the industry, Xiao Wu has not left the factory since the Spring Festival.

Night on the Avenue of Light Xiao Wu

Those who returned home by the end of January were in quarantine and unable to return to work. The pressure on the remaining third of the staff has increased dramatically. I used to work nights once a month or two, ten days at a time. During the outbreak, Xiao Wu was on two night shifts -- from 8.30 pm to 8.30 am the next day. It's a 20-minute walk from the office to the company's temporary quarters. It was bright at the end of the day and quiet at the office.

Xiao Wu showed pictures of the streets around the Valley of light and introduced the masks his company had issued. Most of the pictures were of lunch in the dining hall. "It's terrible. We joke that we eat prison food every day, hehe. " Food Xiaowu used to go to the city every week to explore the shop, hot pot, kebabs uninterrupted, recently can only let the stomach aggrieved.

Takeo's boxed lunch. He said it was tasteless. They say there's been an improvement recently

Photograph by Xiao Wu

Spent the night in an office with the air conditioning turned off. Front line workers work harder and are more dangerous, Xiao Wu said. Second-line staff in the office, the volume of business is not saturated, often is to spend the day. He joined the company late last year and understands the difficulties of the company and has no ability to challenge the factory.

Waking Up at 12 a.m. on the third day after meeting Xiao Wu, Ms. Cao saw a text message from Xiao Wu that read, "someone from the factory next door has been diagnosed. In fact, there was a suspected infection in January, during which there were many ambulance calls. "

Xiao Wu's compound is a kilometer from the plant, separated by a railway line, so it shouldn't be a problem if it's closed. But Xiao Wu was still holding on tight. "The number of confirmed cases in a community near the factory almost matched the number in some cities outside the province, " he told Cao Xi.

On January 21, when Xiao Wu returned to his native Huanggang, few people in Wuhan Railway Station wore face masks. Xiao Wu

Small Wu is not good at speech, be asked what, in the mouth jump out a few words. "I just remember that the most lively thing in the group, except when the group was built, was on the night of Li Wenliang's death. Everyone talked until 4 a.m. "

Xiao Wu envied the liberal arts, calling media practitioners "literary workers" . He felt that he might not be an "ideal chat partner" for Cao Xi and the rest of the group. With the exception of factories and the surrounding area, he had no more information about the Wuhan Epidemic area than people from other provinces.

But in Cao Xi here, Xiao Wu is a real small window, "He is another level of ordinary Wuhan people. "

Cao Xi and Xiao Wu often exchange doodles. On the left are his cats, which Xiao Wu praised as "detailed" , and on the right are Xiao Wu's cats, which he described as "soulful" 

"If there is no torch after this, I am the only light. "

Cao Xi also tried to open other windows, such as the little elephant, a college student he met on Weibo.

The reason to go to Weibo to find, because the plan group of Wuhan friends are not many, Cao Xi want to avoid and other outsiders "hit friends. ". At about the same time, Linzi also felt that the group chat was a departure from its original purpose. He called on everyone to adopt "decentralized" methods, such as mobilizing friends around to introduce Wuhan's friends. In addition to some radical speech he also can not control, so 1,140 people chat group leader and management, were transferred to the forest of friends in the group.

The calf's home is eighty kilometers from the Hankou Railway Station in Xinzhou District, where both parents work in the hospital. Dad's orthopedics had recently closed, and mom was working overtime in the hospital's billing office. This winter vacation besides busy thesis, she also goes to the hospital occasionally to help mother. "It is said that later there were also designated hospitals and patients were transferred. But there were not many. "

A Wax Gourd donated to the mother's hospital

In early January, the baby elephant took heed of a tip to the public in Hong Kong and stocked up on hundreds of masks. "looking at her micro blog, at that time, her family and friends laughed at her for being too nervous and unusual, and she was later 'punched in the face, ' " Cao said.

The calf loved the oddities of the road: The dandruff but smiling at her, the strange vagabonds offering her oranges, the blind people sitting across from her in the waiting room, all made her want to stare and talk.

She teaches Weibo's online filing system for new pneumonia patients, encouraging those with the resources to contact the person seeking help directly. But she also felt more strongly than ever that everyone was covered in a "thick shroud" . "I often feel like I have a lot to say, I can't say it out loud, to anyone. I swell up, I want to express, I want to destroy. "

Let Cao Xi think little elephant is a little different, it is the girl on the "bigger world" never dry enthusiasm and ask. "She spends most of her time retweeting messages and recording her feelings about the siege. It seems that if she doesn't do something now, she will forget it later. "

Not only do they retweet themselves, but they also ask the big V's they follow if they retweet their messages. "Some people promise to follow me. Some people ignore me. " She will study how to retweet more effectively. "One million [ Fan ] big V's are out of reach, and people are less likely to forward requests for help from ordinary patients, mostly donations. The most effective way to do this is to forward to 100,000-200,000 big V's. "

There was an epileptic in Huanggang who had a seizure during the outbreak, because the roads were closed and there was no treatment. Family texted for help, nothing. The calf wants to make contact, but the family has deleted the information. She felt like a saw had been sawed through her. Another little boy in Wuhan, who was just starting his junior year, was thrown to his grandmother after his parents divorced. Grandma suspected new pneumonia can not be hospitalized after the little boy had no choice but to tweet. The baby elephant was pleased to hear that volunteers had contacted the community and that "both the boy and the grandmother were taken care of" .

The calf has also wondered if he is too irritable. Seeing an appreciative emotional blogger with 500,000 followers who is as empathetic and angry as she is, she felt better, "inspired. "

"May all Chinese young people get out of the cold air and just go up, without having to listen to the words of those who give up on themselves. They can do things and make their voices heard. A minute of heat, a minute of light, so that fireflies general, but also in the dark to send a little light. "Do not wait for the torch, for if there is no torch after this, I am the only light, " Lu Xun said, she reissued it during the outbreak.

Although only had a deep talk with the baby elephant and then no longer intersect, but this does not affect Cao Xi to this rigid and fragile girl's appreciation, "this age, has this blood, quite good. "

During the outbreak, the calf's mother worked at a hospital toll booth in the Xinzhou district of Wuhan. The calf feels there has been a marked improvement in doctor-patient relations at the hospital

The calf is unfazed by the activity, which is designed to make friends. "They want to develop a warm and friendly relationship with the people of Wuhan. I think you have the energy to have a chat, so you might as well do something more direct. "

In fact, during the course of the project, someone had already asked the woods: Why don't you help those in need while you're here talking about all this nonsense?

"It's a good question, " says Lin, who has tried everything to help a wuhan-based college student whose family was infected, only to find he couldn't push her. "I realized there was an unbridgeable gap between what we wanted to do and what we could do. So my answer is: Let Wuhan inside and outside strangers at this time to know each other, talk about what is not, is to provide our help within our capacity.

In this time of isolation, talking is a great comfort in itself. It makes people feel that there is a normal side to life, that there is not only disease and eating and drinking and having fun, but also feelings and having fun, and I think that's where human dignity comes in."

Tong Tong, a member of the friends group, sent a photo from Kyoto, where the store limits one person to one mask Tong Tong at a time

Relay

Compared with Xiao Wu and the baby elephant, Liu is closer to the center of the storm.

On New Year's Day in 2020, Xiao Liu, who had a fall at home, went to the Emergency Department of Zhongnan Hospital of Wuhan University at night and received three stitches to his forehead.

Because it was late at night and he was in a hurry, he didn't pay much attention. In the next few days, he went to a clinic near his home to change his dressing, and then on Feb. 13, he went to Zhongnan to have his stitches removed. "It all seemed to be 'normal. ' Not many people wore masks on the subway. "

This job does the medical appliance, before looking at the trauma, Xiao Liu has received the news about the unidentified pneumonia in the profession friend. Out of professional sensitivity, he bought 50 surgical masks online. "It was a two-for-one deal. It was very cheap. "

On January 20th he bought two bottles of alcohol and, with a bit of his family's mask, took a high speed train from the Hankou Railway Station back to his native Shiyan. For more than a month in his hometown, he was haunted by visions and regrets that eventually became nightmares.

A few years ago in the winter, Xiao Liu's home in Wuhan, the scenery outside the window. Usually there are a lot of people on the playground in the school downstairs, but now there is a depression picture / Xiao Liu

Every day for 10 days in early January, I went to the top three hospitals and clinics with a large number of people. When the line was removed, Zhongnan Hospital had been transformed into an infectious ward. When I left Wuhan, I passed through the station at the transportation hub of Foshan, there is a chance of being hit. At one point in Shiyan, he watched Daily News conferences, studying the media's proposed timeline of the outbreak. Did you ever question whether you should come back?

He insists on taking his temperature at home every day. You're an adult, you're doing this again, you know what you're doing, but you can't let it go. "think of me as one of the first people in Wuhan to wear a mask. But you can't have a meeting and eat with a mask on. If there is just one person [ infected ] , in the canteen, in the subway... "

At home, Liu Reading, writing code, livelihood problems are not optimistic. The major hospitals that used to do business now only deal in apparatus related to smoking and fever clinics. Business at Liu's company has been suspended. "My friend had a company that did software development. He went out of business while he was on vacation. "

Well, there's always something to distract you.

Before he was thirty years old, he returned to his grandfather's house in the village. Nearby are the family's green vegetables and orange groves, the distant hills, a little bleak in the winter, but also with a few green. GRANDPA's yard and the kitchen each has a set of longevity utensils, which were prepared by Septuagenarians ten years ago. "My grandparents are in good health and have made peace with life and death. They were a little surprised and said they had never seen such a big 'plague' as far back as they can remember. They didn't tell me much, just said they'd better go back to Wuhan later. "

After joining the friends program, he noticed Xiao Wang with a clinical specialty background. One focuses on biology, the other is fascinated by chemistry and pharmacology, and the two get on well professionally.

Xiao Wang vaguely remember, Xiao Liu mentioned his injury to the hospital. "But he didn't go into too much detail, I just had a vague feeling that he had something on his mind. It wasn't very good. "

For Liu, no matter how many times he met his friends in the planning group, he was a much-needed comfort in difficult times. He hopes that his friends and colleagues who are still in the downtown area of Wuhan can also receive such comfort and help.

Lin Zi, the sponsor, admitted to me that the friends plan was "not nearly as good as it looks" : There were far fewer participants in Wuhan than in other cities, and the proportion of people he talked to was out of Kilter; he didn't have the energy to do it all, how many people have managed to get to know each other. "What's more, people-to-people communication is difficult in itself, and effective communication between strangers is even more difficult. "

Wuhan Curator Ge Wei community piled at the entrance of the food, by the community buyers to help purchase map / Ge Wei

Ge Wei, a Wuhan based art curator in the group, suggested that good chat friends could properly share and post chat notes to extend the project. Ge Wei also remembered that there had been an appointment in the group. One day, when the epidemic ended, everyone went to Wuhan by bicycle relay in different provinces, "they said it was a good idea to send the flag to the Yangtze River in Wuhan -- Foshan. People in every province and city are striving for a better life and a better state for us. "

This for their own "halfway disappear" feel sorry, to hear the proposal, the woods and gave birth to some comfort. "I hope that people in the right place will carry on with this plan. " The thought of what might happen in Wuhan in any city, he felt that this kind of point to point care should become a kind of normality, so that people in a dilemma can break the information bottleneck and no longer be alone.

(reference: "I participated in the program of "knowing a Wuhan Friend" , thanks to all the interviewees. All names in the article are pseudonyms.)
